translated: The Second World War, by its extreme violence, its inhumane persecution (especially towards the Jews), its length (nearly six years) and its human cost (over 55 or even 60 million deaths), marked the twentieth century by becoming the deadliest conflict in history.
original: La Seconde Guerre mondiale, par son extrême violence, ses persécutions inhumaines (notamment envers les Juifs), sa durée (près de six ans) et son bilan humain (plus de 55 voire 60 millions de morts), a marqué le XXème siècle en devenant le conflit le plus meurtrier de l'histoire.
